Module ZiqiYang
Package org.ziqi.gameEngine

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
org.ziqi.gameEngine.GameEngine
public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
GameEngine singleton class to take charge of all sectors of the running game by dispatching jobs to its attached managers and screen player. All tasks requested from other managers and classes will be received and reassigned by GameEngine class.
Author:
Ziqi Yang-modified
See Also:
EventManager, LevelManager, DataManager, MusicManager, ResourceManager, ScreenPlayer

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GameEngine getInstance()
      This is a singleton getter to keep track of and return the unique instance of GameEngine class.
      Returns:
      If there exists an instance of GameEngine class, then this object is returned; Otherwise, a new one is instantiated and returned by called its constructor.

    • getM_ScreenPlayer

      public ScreenPlayer getM_ScreenPlayer()
      Gets the ScreenPlayer object member variable of GameEngine instance.
      Returns:
      The ScreenPlayer object member variable is returned to the caller.

    • getM_GameScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getM_GameScene()
      Gets the scene that is currently showed in the stage of ScreenPlayer.
      Returns:
      The scene object, currently showing and kept track by GameEngine, is returned.
      See Also:
      ScreenPlayer

    • getM_GamingBG

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getM_GamingBG()
      Gets the background image that is currently or will be used in the gaming screen.
      Returns:
      A image as background image of gaming screen is returned.
      See Also:
      Utils.SET_BG_NAMES

    • setM_GamingBG

      public void setM_GamingBG​(javafx.scene.image.Image m_GamingBG)
      Sets the background image that will be used in the coming gaming screen after choosing set.
      Parameters:
      m_GamingBG - Image object that will be used in the coming gaming screen after choosing set.
      See Also:
      LevelSetScreenController.initialize(URL, ResourceBundle)

    • toStartScreen

      public void toStartScreen()
      Assigns tasks to GameManagers and ScreenPlayer to present start screen for the user.
      When called, MusicManager will be called to play start screen background music;
      ScenePlayer will be called to initialize start screen; GameEngine will keep track of the scene that is displayed by ScreenPlayer;
      See Also:
      MusicManager.playBGM(), ScreenPlayer.initScreen(GameScreen, String), StartScreen

    • toGamingScreen

      public void toGamingScreen()
      Assigns tasks to GameManagers and ScreenPlayer to present gaming screen for the user.
      When called, MusicManager will be called to play gaming screen background music;
      ScenePlayer will be called to initialize gaming screen;
      GameEngine will keep track of the scene that is displayed by ScreenPlayer;
      EventManager will subscribe PlayerController for the gaming scene;
      See Also:
      MusicManager.playGamingMusic(), ScreenPlayer.initScreen(GameScreen, String), EventManager.subscribe(), PlayerController, GamingScreen

    • toLevelSetScreen

      public void toLevelSetScreen()
      Assigns tasks to GameManagers and ScreenPlayer to present level selecting screen for the user.
      When called, MusicManager will be called to play background music for level selecting screen ;
      ScenePlayer will be called to initialize level selecting screen;
      GameEngine will keep track of the scene that is displayed by ScreenPlayer;
      See Also:
      MusicManager.playSetChoosingMusic(), ScreenPlayer.initScreen(GameScreen, String), LevelSetScreen

    • toScoreBoardScreen

      public void toScoreBoardScreen()
      Assigns tasks to GameManagers and ScreenPlayer to present score board screen for the user.
      When called, MusicManager will be called to play background music for score board screen;
      ScenePlayer will be called to initialize score board screen;
      GameEngine will keep track of the scene that is displayed by ScreenPlayer;
      See Also:
      MusicManager.playScoreBoardMusic(), ScreenPlayer.initScreen(GameScreen, String), ScoreBoardScreen

    • toVictoryScreen

      public void toVictoryScreen()
      Assigns tasks to GameManagers and ScreenPlayer to present victory screen for the user.
      This method will only be called when a user completes a whole set of levels.
      When called, MusicManager will be called to play background music for victory screen;
      ScenePlayer will be called to initialize victory screen;
      GameEngine will keep track of the scene that is displayed by ScreenPlayer;
      See Also:
      MusicManager.playVictoryScreenMusic(), ScreenPlayer.initScreen(GameScreen, String), VictoryScreen

    • popUpScoreBoard

      public void popUpScoreBoard()
      Assigns tasks to GameManagers and ScreenPlayer to pop up a new screen as score board for the user.
      This method will be called when a user completes a level.
      When called, MusicManager will be called to play background music for score board pop up screen;
      ScenePlayer will be called to initialize score board screen;
      See Also:
      MusicManager.playCompletionMusic(), ScreenPlayer.initScreen(GameScreen, String), ScoreBoardPopUp

    • quit

      public void quit()
      Assigns a task to ScreenPlayer to pop up a new screen as alert window for the user.
      This method will be called when a user intends to exit the program.
      When called, ScenePlayer will be called to initialize the alert window;
      See Also:
      ScreenPlayer.initScreen(GameScreen, String), QuitGamePopUp

    • updateGamingScreen

      public void updateGamingScreen()
      Assigns a task to ScreenPlayer to update the control panel and gaming view of GamingScreen.
      This method will be called when a user is playing the game(gaming screen is showing) and inputs a key that is handled;
      When called, ScenePlayer will be called to update its scene by calling its gaming screen controller;
      See Also:
      ScreenPlayer.initScreen(GameScreen, String), GamingScreen, GamingScreenController
